angles.product_description: The Forgotten Home Apothecary is a 320-page, physical, full-color remedies book that gives people a new way to take care of themselves at home, using remedies they can make with ingredients they already have or with herbs that are cheap, clean, easy to find, and not controlled by anyone. It contains 250 step-by-step natural remedies, each clearly organized by ailment, symptom, or body part. Every remedy includes: clear step-by-step photos, simple ingredients, step-by-step instructions, precise dosages, side effects, medication interactions, sourcing notes, expert tips. The way the table of contents is designed, like an old apothecary shelf, helps people find what they need instantly. It's intuitive, visual, and practical. This book gives people a real alternative to pills and pharmacy products. When people make a remedy at home, they know exactly what goes into it: no fillers, no artificial additives, no hidden chemicals. Unlike medications, there's no prescription, no doctor's visit, no insurance, no gatekeeping, and no high monthly bills. Most remedies cost pennies to make. Instead of paying hundreds of dollars for treatments, consultations, or medications, they pay once for this book and can make remedies for themselves and their families for a lifetime. It becomes a home resource they can rely on in daily life and in emergencies, regardless of hospital and pharmacy shortages or rising healthcare costs. It is a direct, accessible, lifetime tool for people who want control, transparency, affordability, and natural solutions, all in one place.
angles.table_of_contents_description: The images show multiple open-book spreads from The Forgotten Home Apothecary, each designed as richly detailed apothecary shelves displaying remedies with labeled jars, bottles, pouches, and containers arranged in wooden cubbies, accompanied by gold nameplates indicating sections such as Cardiovascular System (47), Digestive System (59), Detox (86), Respiratory System (97), Nervous System (127), Auditory and Visual System (155), Skin Problems and Wounds (221), Personal Care Products (238), Endocrine System (248), Immune System (193), and Musculoskeletal Health (168). The Table of Contents page features a parchment-textured background with floral illustrations, a framed 'Table of Contents' title, and a vertical list of sections including Disclaimer 2, Table of Contents 4, Introduction 13, Part 1: Setting Up Your Herbal Apothecary with subsections Sourcing Quality Herbs and Ingredients 15, Choosing the Right Equipment and Supplies 17, Storage and Preservation 18, Part 2: The Basics: Herbal Preparation and Use 20 with topics Teas, Infusions, Decoctions, Sun Brews 23, Tincture Making 26, Oil Infusions 27, Oxymels 31, Syrups and Elixirs 32, Lozenges, Gummies, Capsules 34, Bandages, Salves, Creams, Lotions 36, Poultices and Plasters 39, Essential Oils and Hydrosols 42. The Cardiovascular System shelves include remedies Cinnamon Infusion for Blood Pressure (49), Heart Harmony Elixir with Hawthorn Berry (50), Garlic and Lemon Tonic for Cholesterol Management (51), Hibiscus Tea for Cardiovascular Support (52), Beetroot and Aronia Juice for Circulatory Health (53), Blood Vessel Care with Butcher's Broom (54), Bilberry Heart-Drops (55), Horse Chestnut Cooling Gel (56), 'Young Heart' Elixir (57), Warming Turmeric and Cayenne Balm (58), Arterial De-Clogger (59). Digestive System shelves show 3-Ingredient Digestive Tonic (60), Chamomile and Lemon Balm Calming Infusion (61), Soothing Syrup for an Upset Stomach (62), Lemon and Ginger Nausea Lollipops (63), Restorative Liver Tea (64), Fatty Liver Tincture (65), Moringa Powder for Liver Detox (66), IBS Relief Peppermint Oil (67), Dandelion and Gentian Bitter Tonic (68), Ginger & ACV for Bloating and Gas Relief (69), Dandelion Lemonade for Gallbladder Health (70), Rejuvelac for Leaky Gut (71), Gut Health Morning Shots (72), Herbal Acid Reflux Reliever (73), Gastritis, Colitis, and Ulcer Tea Blend (74), Bowel-Balance Elixir (75), Anti-Parasitic Black Walnut Drops (76), Nature's Laxative Blend (77), Homemade Colon Detox Shot (78). The Detox shelves include Black Milk (79), Intestinal Relief Infusion (80), Herbal Parasite Flush (81), Fermented Cabbage Juice (82), De-Bloating Yarrow Extract (83), Hemorrhoid-Alleviating Oil (84), Herbal Kombucha for Gut Health (85), All-Day Slimming Tea (87), Bay Leaf Water (88), Flat Tummy Capsules (89), Craving-Buster Brew (90), Dandelion and Burdock Purge (91), Metabolic Herbal Coffee (92), Green Burn Smoothie (93), Forskolin Capsules (94), Cleansing Stinging Nettle Soup (95), Metabolic Superfood Bars (96). Respiratory System shelves include Rosemary and Sage Sore Throat Spray (98), Honey Lemon Ginger Cough Drops (99), Mustard Plaster (100), Heating Potato Pad (101), Amish Cough Syrup (102), Mullein and Marshmallow Cough Syrup (103), Sinus Relief Eucalyptus Steam (104), Hot Herbal Compress for Sinus Infections (105), Herbal Gargle for Throat Infections (106), Soothing Elixir for Cold and Flu Season (107), Grandma's ‘Antibiotic' (108), Homemade Rub for Easy Breathing (109). Nervous System shelves list Thyme and Honey Respiratory Elixir (110), ‘Mighty Lungs' Tincture (111), Cowboy Cough Syrup (112), Hot Toddy (113), Anti-Viral Pine Needle Tincture (114), ‘Jello' Flu Shots (115), Anti-Phlegm Holy Basil Tea (116), Allergy Relief Balm (117), Anti-Histaminic Tea (118), Stinging Nettle Tincture (119), Anti-Mucus Mullein Leaf Infusion (120), Fever-Breaking Onion Socks (121), Vinegar Socks (122), Anti-Fever Elixir (123), Herbal Fever Compress (124), Snore Relief Jelly (125), Turmeric Tonic for Inflammation (126), Memory Elixir (128), Brain Boosting Tonic (129), Natural Brain Booster (130), Brain Power Mushroom Elixir (131), The Mind-Sharpening Infusion (132), Ginkgo Biloba Focus Fuel (133), Anti-Migraine Syrup (134), Herbal Blend for Headache Relief (135), Moon Milk for Better Sleep (136), Nature's ‘Aspirin' (137), Deep Sleep Banana Tea (138), Soothing Herbal Soak (139). Skin Problems and Wounds (221) shelves include Antiseptic Ointment (222), Nature's ‘Betadine' (223), Healing Cream for Rashes (224), Soothe-and-Heal Ointment (225), Antibiotic Cream (226), Calendula Infusion for Cuts (227). Personal Care Products (238) shelves show Rosemary Hair Growth Spray (240), Arnica Salve for Age Spots (241), Natural Herbal Toothpaste (242), Gum-Strengthening Mouthwash (243), 'Better Than Botox' (244), Herbal Facial Oil (245), Natural Deodorant Stick (246), Natural Herbal Sunscreen (247). Endocrine System (248) shelves include Bugleweed Glycerite for Thyroid Balance (250), Bladderwrack Tincture for Thyroid Support (251), PCOS Support Blend (252), Spiced Milk for Pancreas (253), Bitter Melon and Green Tea Blend (254), Backyard Pancreas Support (255), Rhodiola Capsules for Cortisol Balance (256), Hormone Harmony Elixir (257). Immune System (193) shelves include Immune-Boosting Elderberry Syrup (194), Turmeric Immune Booster (195), Garlic Honey Antibiotic (196), Penicillin Soup (197), Echinacea Herbal Antibiotic (198), Antiviral Immunity Blend (199). Musculoskeletal Health (168) shelves include Painkiller in a Jar (169), Amish Ibuprofen (170), Cartilage Support Cream (171), Comfrey and Arnica Joint Support (172), 'Better Than Collagen' (173), Herbal Liniment for Sore Muscles (174), Soothe-and-Restore Joint Oil (178), Anti-Inflammatory Turmeric Tincture (179), DIY Healing Poultice (180). Each page features meticulously shaded jars, amber glass, herbal bundles, wooden textures, green botanical sprigs, and consistently styled white labels, forming a visual apothecary map of all 250 natural remedies included in the book.
angles.pdf_imag_description: The cover depicts an ornate vintage apothecary cabinet framed by a thick, dark walnut wooden border carved with intricate botanical patterns, giving the impression of an antique, handcrafted medicine chest. Inside the frame sit five tightly packed shelves filled from end to end with dozens of old-fashioned apothecary bottles and jars in a variety of shapes and colors, including amber, green, clear, and occasional blue glass. Each bottle features an aged parchment label with faded black handwritten or serif text reminiscent of 19th-century medicinal notation. Interspersed between the bottles are small clay pots, sprigs of herbs, dried flowers, and small clusters of green leaves, adding touches of botanical life among the glassware. The shelves are made of the same deep brown wood as the frame, and the warm, golden, diffuse lighting gives the scene a cozy, nostalgic glow, highlighting the soft reflections on the glass and the smoky patina on the labels. Centered over the shelves is a large, cream-colored rectangular plaque bordered with delicate green vine illustrations. At the top of the plaque, in small green italic serif text, is the phrase 'The Forgotten'. Beneath it, a large curved red banner with soft shadows and embossed cream lettering displays the words 'HOME APOTHECARY' in two lines, the top word smaller and the lower word dominant. Below the banner, still on the plaque, is the text '250 Powerful Remedies at Your Fingertips', with '250' printed in a large dark green serif font and the rest in smaller matching serif type. Botanical flourishes extend from the corners of the plaque, blending harmoniously with the surrounding shelves. At the bottom center of the carved wooden frame, in gold serif lettering with a slight engraved appearance, is the author's name: 'Nicole Apelian, Ph.D.' The overall aesthetic evokes a sense of historical herbal wisdom, craftsmanship, and vintage natural medicine, with warm tones, richly textured wood, and nostalgic apothecary elements unifying the composition.

remedies_list: Penicillin Soup (this is a winter immune booster)
Amish Amoxicillin (this is a Natural antibiotic formula)
Herbal Parasite Flush (this is Parasite cleanser, and it's good for gut health)
Nature's Amoxicillin (herb-based antibiotic it's a juice made from turmeric, ginger, ACV, black pepper, lemon, honey)
Jello Flu Shots (Cold/flu immune shot recipe)
Restorative Liver Tea / Liver Detox Tincture (Liver cleansing, detox support)
ad_scripts:
(Spokesperson is shown from the torso up, pointing with their index finger upwards, towards the writing on the screen; they are looking at the camera, then moving their head slightly up, to look at the writing, then they move their look at the camera again)
(The writing is on a white backdrop, the font color is black)
“I got you!”
(The scene cuts to a close-up of the table of contents. The camera focuses on the page while the spokesperson's index finger moves across the entries from left to right, stopping on the specific remedy being discussed; the spokesperson's finger stops on Amish Amoxicillin, then taps 2-4 times on the illustrated remedy)
“So, what's really cool about this book is that it's actually organized by ailment, so it makes it feel like you're actually walking through an herbal apothecary and picking what you need right off the shelf! Here we go!”
(The spokesperson proceeds to underline with their finger each section name inside the book, first Ingredients, then Instructions, then Dosage, and as they tap on each title of each section, they also read the name of each section)
It's gonna give you Ingredients, and step-by-step instructions, with dosage.
(We see the hand of the spokesperson proceeding to flip the pages of the book to arrive at the Side Effects and Allergies section, tapping on the name of the section; then proceeds to move lower down the page to Interactions with Medications)
This book also gives you information on Side Effects and Allergies, as well as Interactions with Medications.
(The spokesperson flips the pages of the extensive interactions with medications list)
And guys, they give you a really detailed list here!
(The spokesperson flips again through the pages listing all the recipes inside the book)
This book has over 250 recipes!
(The scene cuts to Natural Alternatives for Personal Care Products, taps with the index finger on the title of the section)
There's even natural alternatives to personal care products!
(The scene cuts to Sourcing Quality Herbs and Ingredients, taps with the index finger on the title of the section)
As well as information on sourcing your herbs and ingredients!
(The scene cuts to a close-up of the author's page, namely Dr. Nicole Apelian, we see the spokesperson's index finger tapping on the title of the section)
This book was written by an herbalist that actually has M.S.
(The scene cuts to a close-up of the author's photo from the About the Author page, the spokesperson taps on the photo of the author)
And this is her, Dr. Nicole Apelian.
(The scene then cuts to the spokesperson's hand closing the book as it reveals the cover of the book, the spokesperson's index finger taps on the title of the book that can be seen on the cover)
This is the Forgotten Home Apothecary and this is a fantastic resource, guys! I think everyone should have a copy of this in their home.
(The spokesperson holds their hand in a loose fist, with the index finger extended downward, pointing below the frame of the video. The gesture is deliberate and slow, suggesting they are directing the viewer's attention to something important placed below such as a link. The movement conveys subtle emphasis, commonly used in video content to nonverbally cue the audience to 'look below' for more information.)
I left a link down below this video so you can get one!

(A young adult man is sitting indoors in a casual setting. He has shoulder-length hair, a beard, and is wearing a dark baseball cap and glasses. The background appears to be a workshop or garage, with wooden walls and yellow industrial shelving visible. The camera is slightly close-up; Overlaid Text (black font, white backdrop) reads: “Was that a Recipe for Herpes?” followed by a sprout emoji and a lips emoji; The text is placed right above the middle of the video, as the spokesperson underlines with their index finger the comment from left to right, then proceeds to speak)
That right there is exactly why they want to ban this book.
(Spokesperson makes a small hand gesture, as if emphasizing a point)
Watch this video very carefully.
(The shot then proceeds to change to a close-up view of an open book called The Forgotten Home Apothecary, on page showing a grid of labeled jars and containers arranged like an apothecary shelf...)
All right guys, it's right here.
(Then we move to another close-up shot of the Forgotten Home Apothecary book being flipped through quickly...)
(We switch to another close-up of the page titled “Herbal Balm for Herpes Sores.” The spokesperson taps the title...)
Right here, it's going to give you ingredients and step by step instructions with dosage.
(We then move into another close-up which reveals the cover of The Forgotten Home Apothecary)
This is The Forgotten Home Apothecary.
(Another close-up shot of the spokesperson flipping pages)
And it has over 250 powerful remedies that have just been lost over time.
(The table of contents is actually laid out like you're walking in an actual apothecary)
And pulling something off the shelf.
(This book was written by one of America's top herbalists, with over 30 years of experience in studying medicinal plants.)
Guys, this book is a fantastic resource, and I think everyone should have a copy of this in their home.
(If you want to grab it I put a link down at the bottom left so you can.)

(A close-up shot of the lower half of a person's face, cheek/jawline/lips, with gauze and a yellow poultice applied)
(A fast sequence of natural remedy shots follows...)
Have you ever wondered why they don't tell you how to make nature's amoxicillin at home?
Or how to make a painkiller in a jar?
(Shot of honey and jalapeños being prepared...)
What about discovering the most potent natural antibiotics…
Or learning how to bring down fever naturally?
(A series of close-ups of herbal remedies, tinctures, powders, poultices, and irritated skin being treated...)
These are the kinds of secrets that have been forgotten over time, but we believe they shouldn't be.
(Sequence continues... jars, herbal preparations, pages being flipped, ingredients highlighted, Anti-Fungal Powder page, table of contents, etc.)
That's why we created The Forgotten Home Apothecary to teach you how to create effective remedies for various issues you might want to address.
In it you'll discover 250 remedies, each with its own step-by-step guide
So, you can prepare them at home.
We only made a few copies of this book, so what are you waiting for?
Hurry up and get yours before it's sold out.

(A middle-aged woman in a bright kitchen with a botanical-print apron speaks calmly...)
In a crisis, when hospitals get looted, pharmacies run dry, and the grid goes down,
(Show cover of the Forgotten Home Apothecary)
it's so much better to have a sturdy, physical book by your side,
than a digital one that you won't be able to access when you need it most.
But you can always rely on the Forgotten Home Apothecary.
(The hardcover version is shown upright)
So here are just a few of the remedies you'll find on these shelves.
Here's the Painkiller in a Jar.
Another great remedy is Amish Ibuprofen.
The next remedy... is called Jello Flu Shots.
These are just some of the 250 remedies you'll find inside your new Apothecary.
Today only, you can get the Forgotten Home Apothecary and multiple bonus guides if you act fast.
I don't want you to miss out on this offer! This is the only time I can promise you'll be able to get the Forgotten Home Apothecary at this price.

Annie stands behind a counter in a vintage apothecary-style room.
I'm getting your order ready.
Thanks for ordering!
With this book it's like having an Apothecary like the one behind me in your own home.
(A series of jars shown: brain-boosting extract, anti-bloating liquid, parasite-removal extract, cleansing infusion, gut-health ferment, etc.)
In here you'll find all the 250 remedies, organized on shelves by specific ailments.
Each page of the appendix displays the powerful remedies found inside the book, and the page you're going to find it.
In the Forgotten Home Apothecary, you can find easy-to-understand instructions, color photos, ingredients, and dosages so you can easily recreate any of these 250 remedies at home.
No other book brings together such powerful natural remedies and turns them into simple, practical blueprints that anyone can follow.
From The Forgotten Home Apothecary, you will learn to prepare remedies like The Natural Painkiller, Amish Amoxicillin, The Herbal Parasite Flush, Black Milk, the Memory Elixir, Heavy Metal Detoxifier, Grandma's Hot Salve for Back Pain, the Colon Detox Shots, the Penicillin Soup, the Jello Flu Shots, and more.
But if you want to secure these 250 remedies for your family, you need to hurry, as they're quickly running out.Click the link below to see if there's still a copy available for you!

hooks.title: Why Weren't We Taught This in School?
hooks.description: Selfie-style footage with a 45-year-old white male wearing a reversed white baseball hat and a green t-shirt. He films himself top-down with his phone in his left hand. On-screen red text appears immediately: 'Why weren't we taught this in school?!?!?' He says: 'Can someone tell me why we never learned any of this in school?' The text then changes to: 'Homemade Colon detox Shots' with a small cup emoji. Three seconds have passed; hook ends.

hooks.title: Jello Flu Shots
hooks.description: Selfie-style footage with a 48-year-old white male wearing a beanie and a coat. He films himself at face level in a nature setting with a hillside. On-screen text reads: 'Really, there's a thing called “Jello” Flu Shots' with a surprised emoji. He says: 'No better time to check this out than right now!' Three seconds pass; hook ends and video continues showing the 'Jello Flu Shots' remedy.

hooks.title: Lemon & Garlic Tonic Mystery
hooks.description: Selfie-style footage with a 45-year-old white male wearing a reversed white baseball hat and white t-shirt. He films himself while walking in a park/backyard setting with greenery, kids' swing, and a white picket fence. Middle-screen text from the start reads: 'WTH is the Lemon and Garlic Tonic used for?' with garlic and pondering emojis. He says: 'We as a society have become so reliant on medicines…' Three seconds pass; hook ends.

hooks.title: Fruits NOT to Eat After 39
hooks.description: Selfie-style footage with a 45-year-old white male wearing a grey t-shirt. He films at face level and sits on a bench in a park. On-screen text appears at the start: 'What Fruits NOT to Eat After 39 years'. He says: 'There's a reason why they keep trying to remove this book.' Three seconds pass; hook ends.

hooks.title: Why Don't They Tell You… Honey & Cinnamon
hooks.description: Professionally filmed in a kitchen. A 45-year-old white woman in denim begins speaking immediately: 'Why don't they tell you what happens if you pour honey over cinnamon??' Camera cuts to her performing the action in fast-forward. Three seconds pass; hook ends. The video transitions into more 'why don't they tell you' intrigue questions.

hooks.title: Look How Many People Bought the Book
hooks.description: Shot inside a warehouse with pallets of The Forgotten Home Apothecary book. Hook starts with a large batch of books being moved. Person says: 'Look how many people have already bought The Forgotten Home Apothecary.' Cut to a woman putting shipping labels on envelopes in fast-forward. Three seconds pass; hook ends.

hooks.title: Don't Lose Weight. Change Your Metabolism.
hooks.description: Shot in a kitchen with low-fi professional setup. Spokeswoman sits with books beside her, cabbage in front. On-screen headline reads: 'Don't lose weight. Change your metabolism instead.' She says: 'Most people don't know this but the type of person you are is dictated by your gut flora.' Cut to an image of three women representing ectomorph, endomorph, mesomorph. Three seconds pass; hook ends.

hooks.title: You Asked, We Listened (Social Proof Comment Flood)
hooks.description: Close-up of the book cover on a table with three jars of remedies. Female voice says: 'You asked, we listened!' As the text stays on screen, the screen rapidly fills with user comments requesting recipes, books, remedies, and asking questions. Comments flood the screen fast until it's full. Three seconds pass; hook ends.

hooks.title: Amish Amoxicillin
hooks.description: Hook begins with a jar labeled 'Amish Amoxicillin' filled with yellowish liquid. Voice says the same as on-screen text: 'Here is the Amish Amoxicillin which is a herbal concoction designed to…' Cut to the recipe inside the book with a female hand pointing across the page. Three seconds pass; hook ends.

ad_scripts.title: Black Milk Remedy Flip-Through
ad_scripts.hook_description: TikTok-style selfie footage filmed by an African American woman 35+ wearing glasses, sitting at home (bed or couch not visible) with two pastel paintings in the background. From the very start, on-screen text above her head reads: 'Show us the black milk' followed by a black dot emoji and a glass of milk emoji. She says: 'This is why they wanna ban the book y-all. Pay very close attention to this video.'
ad_scripts.ad_description: After the initial hook, the next frame shows the product — The Forgotten Home Apothecary book — being slammed onto a desk with an audible thump, music playing in the background. The following frame shows the book opened at the table of contents; the shot begins on the left page and moves to the right, clearly showing remedies laid out on 'shelves' like an apothecary, each shelf representing a body system. The Cardiovascular system is visible with the Digestive system underneath. The camera pans to the bottom right as the person flips the page with her hand. The next frame shows the following page in the table of contents where, in the top left, we see the remedy 'black milk.' The person taps it with her index finger and says: 'This one. Right here.' The next frame shows a hand flipping through the pages to reach the remedy. Then we see the book open at page 79, the page with the black milk remedy, with a zoom-in effect on the page. She says: 'You guys… read this veeery carefully,' emphasizing the word 'very,' while the camera pans from left to right across the page. She moves her index finger over the different sections of the remedy while saying in order: 'It's got all the ingredients' (running her finger up and down the ingredients box), 'All the instructions on how to do it' (circling the instructions box), and 'Even the dosage' (circling the dosage box). There is a loud thump sound as the book is slammed shut, with a zoom in-and-out effect on the cover. She concludes: 'This book is a must have for every home in America. Be sure to get your copy down below.' The ad ends, with a total runtime of about 44 seconds including the hook.
